title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel about the American Dream' set in the roaring 1920s

author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful story of racial injustice in the American South' seen through the eyes of a young girl.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian masterpiece that explores surveillance and totalitarianism in a grim future.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A timeless romance between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy in 19th-century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye

description: A coming-of-age novel following the adventures of Holden Caulfield in New York City.

author: Herman Melville
description: Embark on a whaling voyage with Captain Ahab in pursuit of the elusive white whale.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Follow Frodo Baggins and his companions on a quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.

description: A sweeping epic of love and war set against the backdrop of 19th-century Russia.

author: Homer
description: Join Odysseus on his epic voyage home after the Trojan War' encountering gods and monsters.

description: A multi-generational tale of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: Explore the consequences of scientific experimentation and the creation of life.

author: Lewis Carroll

author: Stephen King

author: Charles Dickens

author: Dan Brown

author: Ken Follett

description: A poignant love story between two teenagers who meet at a cancer support
